{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphics Designer",
  "description": "Dana Group is a leading Nigerian conglomerate, a major contributor to the industrialization and economic growth of Nigeria for over five decades. With a maiden venture in pharmaceutical manufacturing in the mid-1980s, we have diversified into market-leading businesses across key sectors like: Pharmaceuticals, Automobile, Production of Household Plastics, Aviation etc . We are committed to providing quality products and services that positively impact daily life and well-being

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Oshodi-Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Dana Group, a leading industrial conglomerate in Nigeria, is seeking a creative and experienced Graphics Designers to join our team in Lagos.
	We&#39;re looking for a talented Graphics Designer with 3-6 years of experience in creating visually appealing designs across various platforms.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio and excellent communication skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Design engaging graphics for social media, websites, advertisements, and print materials
	Collaborate with marketing and content teams to develop creative concepts
	Maintain consistency in branding across all design projects
	Edit and retouch images to enhance visual appeal
	Prepare design files for print and digital publishing.


Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in any discipline
	At least 4 years of hands-on experience as a Graphics Designer with a strong portfolio (attach portfolio link)
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other design software
	Solid understanding of typography, color theory, and layout techniques
	Ability to meet deadlines and excellent communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio link to:&nbsp;vacancies@danagroup.com&nbsp;using &quot;Graphics Designer&quot; as the subject of the email.

Note


	This role is fully onsite, and candidates residing around Oshodi, Mafoluku, Mile 2, Airport Road, Ikeja, Isolo, Surulere, Ejigbo, and environs will be given priority due to proximity to the company location.
	If you&#39;re a creative and driven Graphics Designer looking for a new challenge,apply now!
",

Graphics Designer Job at Dana Group




        
    

        
        Dana Group is a leading Nigerian conglomerate, a major contributor to the industrialization and economic growth of Nigeria for over five decades. With a maiden venture in pharmaceutical manufacturing in the mid-1980s, we have diversified into market-leading businesses across key sectors like: Pharmaceuticals, Automobile, Production of Household Plastics, Aviation etc . We are committed to providing quality products and services that positively impact daily life and well-being

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Oshodi-Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Dana Group, a leading industrial conglomerate in Nigeria, is seeking a creative and experienced Graphics Designers to join our team in Lagos.
	We're looking for a talented Graphics Designer with 3-6 years of experience in creating visually appealing designs across various platforms.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio and excellent communication skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Design engaging graphics for social media, websites, advertisements, and print materials
	Collaborate with marketing and content teams to develop creative concepts
	Maintain consistency in branding across all design projects
	Edit and retouch images to enhance visual appeal
	Prepare design files for print and digital publishing.


Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in any discipline
	At least 4 years of hands-on experience as a Graphics Designer with a strong portfolio (attach portfolio link)
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other design software
	Solid understanding of typography, color theory, and layout techniques
	Ability to meet deadlines and excellent communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio link to: vacancies@danagroup.com using "Graphics Designer" as the subject of the email.

Note


	This role is fully onsite, and candidates residing around Oshodi, Mafoluku, Mile 2, Airport Road, Ikeja, Isolo, Surulere, Ejigbo, and environs will be given priority due to proximity to the company location.
	If you're a creative and driven Graphics Designer looking for a new challenge,apply now!
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Glybridge Schools is a premium but cost-effective citadel of learning for boys and girls from pre-school to year 13 (sixth form), who receive intensive tuition, routed through a comprehensive hybrid of British and Nigerian curricula. We had integrated the different school arms under our corporate plan in order to be in control of the foundation we are building on and afterwards allow each student to properly transcend into each new phase seamlessly.

What distinguishes Glybridge is the fact that it is both an educational institution and a christian mandate, uniquely designed to raise a generation of intellectually sound individuals who are deeply rooted in the fear of the Lord. This dynamic blend enables us to mould destinies that will not only excel in academics but also stand out in character, innovation and social impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki - Sangotedo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
As the school accountant, you will be required to:


	Prepare, examine, and maintain financial records and reports.
	Handle accounts payable and receivable, including reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Maintain accurate records of company assets, liabilities, income, and expenses.
	Ensure compliance with statutory tax obligations and filings.
	Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
	Collaborate with auditors and support the audit process.
	Provide financial insights to support decision-making.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 2 years of experience.&nbsp;


Method of Applicatioon
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;glybridgeschool@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;For Inquiries, contact 08086500752.",

Accountant Job at Glybridge Schools




        
    

        
        Glybridge Schools is a premium but cost-effective citadel of learning for boys and girls from pre-school to year 13 (sixth form), who receive intensive tuition, routed through a comprehensive hybrid of British and Nigerian curricula. We had integrated the different school arms under our corporate plan in order to be in control of the foundation we are building on and afterwards allow each student to properly transcend into each new phase seamlessly.
     

            
    



What distinguishes Glybridge is the fact that it is both an educational institution and a christian mandate, uniquely designed to raise a generation of intellectually sound individuals who are deeply rooted in the fear of the Lord. This dynamic blend enables us to mould destinies that will not only excel in academics but also stand out in character, innovation and social impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Lekki - Sangotedo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
As the school accountant, you will be required to:


	Prepare, examine, and maintain financial records and reports.
	Handle accounts payable and receivable, including reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Maintain accurate records of company assets, liabilities, income, and expenses.
	Ensure compliance with statutory tax obligations and filings.
	Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
	Collaborate with auditors and support the audit process.
	Provide financial insights to support decision-making.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 2 years of experience. 


Method of Applicatioon
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: glybridgeschool@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For Inquiries, contact 08086500752.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "D&#39;Allure Interiors -&nbsp;We are a forward-thinking interior design company passionate about transforming spaces into timeless, functional, and aesthetically pleasing environments. Our mission is to inspire clients with creative design solutions while building a strong online presence that reflects our brand&rsquo;s vision.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a Social Media Manager to develop, implement, and oversee our social media strategies.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong eye for design, storytelling, and branding, with the ability to create engaging content that resonates with our audience and highlights our interior design expertise.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a results-driven social media strategy aligned with the company&rsquo;s brand identity and business goals.
	Create, curate, and manage high-quality visual and written content (posts, reels, stories, carousels, etc.) for platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, and Facebook.
	Collaborate with the design team to highlight completed projects, mood boards, and design inspirations.
	Manage the social media calendar, ensuring consistent posting and timely updates.
	Monitor, analyse, and report on performance metrics (engagement, reach, conversions) to optimize strategies.
	Engage with followers, respond to comments, and foster a strong online community.
	Research and stay updated on social media trends, interior design trends, and competitor activities.
	Coordinate with photographers and videographers for content production when needed.
	Run targeted ad campaigns to increase brand visibility and generate leads.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree
	1 - 3 years of proven experience as a Social Media Manager, preferably within the design, lifestyle, or creative industries.
	Background in marketing, communications, or a design-related field.
	Strong knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn best practices.
	Excellent communication and copywriting skills with a creative flair.
	Proficiency in content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, etc.).
	Ability to analyse data and adjust strategies accordingly.
	Knowledge of paid social advertising collaborations.
	Passion for interior design, trends, and aesthetics.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Basic photography or videography skills.
	Experience with SEO and content marketing strategies.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolios to:&nbsp;dallure.interiors@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Social Media Manager Job at D'Allure Interiors




        
    

        
        D'Allure Interiors - We are a forward-thinking interior design company passionate about transforming spaces into timeless, functional, and aesthetically pleasing environments. Our mission is to inspire clients with creative design solutions while building a strong online presence that reflects our brand’s vision.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Social Media Manager to develop, implement, and oversee our social media strategies.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong eye for design, storytelling, and branding, with the ability to create engaging content that resonates with our audience and highlights our interior design expertise.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a results-driven social media strategy aligned with the company’s brand identity and business goals.
	Create, curate, and manage high-quality visual and written content (posts, reels, stories, carousels, etc.) for platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, and Facebook.
	Collaborate with the design team to highlight completed projects, mood boards, and design inspirations.
	Manage the social media calendar, ensuring consistent posting and timely updates.
	Monitor, analyse, and report on performance metrics (engagement, reach, conversions) to optimize strategies.
	Engage with followers, respond to comments, and foster a strong online community.
	Research and stay updated on social media trends, interior design trends, and competitor activities.
	Coordinate with photographers and videographers for content production when needed.
	Run targeted ad campaigns to increase brand visibility and generate leads.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	1 - 3 years of proven experience as a Social Media Manager, preferably within the design, lifestyle, or creative industries.
	Background in marketing, communications, or a design-related field.
	Strong knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn best practices.
	Excellent communication and copywriting skills with a creative flair.
	Proficiency in content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, CapCut, etc.).
	Ability to analyse data and adjust strategies accordingly.
	Knowledge of paid social advertising collaborations.
	Passion for interior design, trends, and aesthetics.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Basic photography or videography skills.
	Experience with SEO and content marketing strategies.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolios to: dallure.interiors@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Quality Control Officer Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	To monitor service and productsstandards across business units
	Conduct regular process audits
	Enforce operational excellence
	Ensure process efficiency and staff productiveness.


Requirements


	HND / BSc Degree in Accounting
	4 - 5 years in hospitality or retail quality assurance
	Detail driven.

HR Manager and Head of Administration Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest Corporate Support Limited - Our client in the hospitality industry is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Manager and Head of Administration
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for experienced professionals to fill leadership roles in their organization.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	To Lead all HR functions, drive staff performance, and embed organizational culture.
	Ensure compliance with policies and procedures, labour and regulatory laws and maintain high service standards across departments.


Requirements


	Qualification: BSc. In any Social Sciences filed. Minimum of 2:2.
	Experience: 7+ years in senior HR roles and ready to work from anywhere in Lagos
	Traits: People-first mindset, decisive, with strong interpersonal and policy enforcement skills.


Salary
Very attractive with other benefits
